a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 2 * x powr 2 + 7 * x - 3"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 + 5 * x - 12"
shows  "\<forall> x. P x - Q x = x powr 2 + 2 * x + 9"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $(2x^2 + 7x - 3) - (x^2 + 5x - 12)$. The final Answer is x^2+2x+9
 ### Proof
 We have  \begin{align} &(2x^2 + 7x - 3) - (x^2 + 5x - 12) \\ &\qquad = 2x^2 + 7x - 3 - x^2 - 5x + 12\\ &\qquad = (2x^2 - x^2) +(7x-5x) +(12-3)\\ &\qquad = \boxed{x^2+2x+9}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 2 * x powr 2 + 7 * x - 3"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 + 5 * x - 12"
shows  "\<forall> x. P x - Q x = x powr 2 + 2 * x + 9"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: For all real numbers $x$, if $P(x) = 2x^2 + 7x - 3$ and $Q(x) = x^2 + 5x - 12$, show that $P(x) - Q(x) = x^2 + 2x + 9$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = 2 * x powr 2 + 7 * x - 3"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. g x = x powr 2 + 5 * x - 12"
shows  "f x - g x = x powr 2 + 2 * x + 9"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $(2x^2 + 7x - 3) - (x^2 + 5x - 12)$. The final Answer is x^2+2x+9
 ### Proof
 We have  \begin{align} &(2x^2 + 7x - 3) - (x^2 + 5x - 12) \\ &\qquad = 2x^2 + 7x - 3 - x^2 - 5x + 12\\ &\qquad = (2x^2 - x^2) +(7x-5x) +(12-3)\\ &\qquad = \boxed{x^2+2x+9}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = 2 * x powr 2 + 7 * x - 3"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. g x = x powr 2 + 5 * x - 12"
shows  "f x - g x = x powr 2 + 2 * x + 9"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Subtract the function $g(x) = x^2 + 5x - 12$ from the function $f(x) = 2x^2 + 7x - 3$. The result is $x^2 + 2x + 9$.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = 2 * x powr 2 + 7 * x - 3"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. g x = x powr 2 + 5 * x - 12"
shows  "f x - g x = x powr 2 + 2 * x + 9"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $(2x^2 + 7x - 3) - (x^2 + 5x - 12)$. The final Answer is x^2+2x+9
 ### Proof
 We have  \begin{align} &(2x^2 + 7x - 3) - (x^2 + 5x - 12) \\ &\qquad = 2x^2 + 7x - 3 - x^2 - 5x + 12\\ &\qquad = (2x^2 - x^2) +(7x-5x) +(12-3)\\ &\qquad = \boxed{x^2+2x+9}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = 2 * x powr 2 + 7 * x - 3"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. g x = x powr 2 + 5 * x - 12"
shows  "f x - g x = x powr 2 + 2 * x + 9"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: Find the difference between the function $f(x) = 2x^2 + 7x - 3$ and the function $g(x) = x^2 + 5x - 12$. The result is $x^2 + 2x + 9$.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 2*x powr 2 + 7*x - 3"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 + 5*x - 12"
shows  "\<forall> x. P x - Q x = x powr 2 + 2*x + 9"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $(2x^2 + 7x - 3) - (x^2 + 5x - 12)$. The final Answer is x^2+2x+9
 ### Proof
 We have  \begin{align} &(2x^2 + 7x - 3) - (x^2 + 5x - 12) \\ &\qquad = 2x^2 + 7x - 3 - x^2 - 5x + 12\\ &\qquad = (2x^2 - x^2) +(7x-5x) +(12-3)\\ &\qquad = \boxed{x^2+2x+9}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 2*x powr 2 + 7*x - 3"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 + 5*x - 12"
shows  "\<forall> x. P x - Q x = x powr 2 + 2*x + 9"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: For any real number $x$, if $P(x)$ is a function defined by $P(x) = 2x^2 + 7x - 3$ and $Q(x)$ is a function defined by $Q(x) = x^2 + 5x - 12$, then show that for all $x$, $P(x) - Q(x) = x^2 + 2x + 9$.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 2 * x powr 2 + 7 * x - 3"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 + 5 * x - 12"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = P x - Q x"
shows  "R x = x powr 2 + 2 * x + 9"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $(2x^2 + 7x - 3) - (x^2 + 5x - 12)$. The final Answer is x^2+2x+9
 ### Proof
 We have  \begin{align} &(2x^2 + 7x - 3) - (x^2 + 5x - 12) \\ &\qquad = 2x^2 + 7x - 3 - x^2 - 5x + 12\\ &\qquad = (2x^2 - x^2) +(7x-5x) +(12-3)\\ &\qquad = \boxed{x^2+2x+9}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 2 * x powr 2 + 7 * x - 3"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 + 5 * x - 12"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = P x - Q x"
shows  "R x = x powr 2 + 2 * x + 9"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: Given the functions $P(x) = 2x^2 + 7x - 3$, $Q(x) = x^2 + 5x - 12$, and $R(x) = P(x) - Q(x)$, find the expression for $R(x)$. The final answer is $R(x) = x^2 + 2x + 9$.

theorem
fixes x :: real
shows  "(2 * x powr 2 + 7 * x - 3) - (x powr 2 + 5 * x - 12) = x powr 2 + 2 * x + 9"
